cyclone.name: ZETA
cyclone.current_location: about 255 miles south-southeast of the western tip of Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: expected to turn WNW, skirt the Yucatan Channel late Monday, then move north-northwest across the central Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast (LA/MS area) by mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast (likely Louisiana / Mississippi) late Wednesday

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch only in effect for Pinar del Rio, Cuba
weather_observation.warning_coast: None in the United States at this advisory
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Yucatan Peninsula, western Cuba, and the north-central U.S. Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana eastward to Alabama/Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Low (≤5%) chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds late Wednesday–Thursday; otherwise only breezy conditions.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for the Beaumont area under the current forecast track.
weather_observation.rainfall: Only light rain bands possible; heaviest rainfall forecast well east of Beaumont.
weather_observation.other_hazards: None identified that would significantly affect port operations under the present forecast.
